init_text:
Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion,

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: we are being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I think we have a responsibility to know what is going on in the world.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: If you are a U.S. citizen, you have even more responsibility because we live in such a powerful country and the things our nation does have

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: a huge impact on other countries and all the people in the world.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Even if you aren't a U.S. citizen, I think it is important to at least know what's going on in the world and understand

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: the connections of your actions to the rest of the world.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: By being informed, you can make better decisions and be a purposeful part of your community and the world.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Especially in the age of social media, it is so easy to become informed just by following your favorite news sites on Facebook or watching/listening to

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: one of the many news sources on YouTube or any number of other places.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: It's become so easy that it can't be a viable excuse anymore.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I also think that events from last year and this year have made it even more important to stay informed.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: No matter if you're a Trump supporter or not, the things that he has done since taking office have been huge news.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Fake news has also been a huge topic, and it is inevitable that people will misunderstand what is going on.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: If you are informed, you can help others understand what is really happening.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Also, just by being informed, you will be able to connect the things you learn to things that you already know.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: You will be able to ask questions and look for answers.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: You will be a much more active and engaged citizen in your city, your state, and the nation.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I feel very strongly about being informed, and I care about what's going on in the world.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I think it's a shame that so many people are not informed, and I'd like to change that.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I hope I can make people more informed by asking them them if they know what is going on in the world.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: You don't have to like what you learn, but you can accept that it is happening and informedly fill in the blanks.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I don't like what I saw on the news today, but I accept that it is real and at least try to find new information to understand it

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: and be a better citizen because of it.

actions.name: text-delete
actions.text: If you are informed, you can help others understand what is really happening.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: If you are informed, you can help others understand what is really happening.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Whether you don't have time or you just chose to be blind and not pay attention to what is happening in the world, you should

actions.name: text-delete
actions.text: Whether you don't have time or you just chose to be blind and not pay attention to what is happening in the world, you should

actions.name: text-delete
actions.text: accept that it is real and at least
